Header: Italy’s Mount Etna spews volcanic ash
Content: Sicily’s Mount Etna, Europe’s tallest and most active volcano, erupted on Thursday (May 30) spewing lava and volcanic ash into the sky above Catania. According to Italy’s National Institute of Geophysics and Vulcanology (INGV), the eruption was preceded by a few weeks of isolated seismic events before two fissures opened on the New Southeast Crater. The northern lava flow reached a distance of around two km on Friday (May 31) morning, INGV reported, whilst the southern flow reached an estimated total length of three km. The 3,330-metre high volcano often erupts but rarely causes damage. Catania airport currently remains open.
